transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, rahul. welcome to the interview for the full stack developer role. how are you today?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. im doing well, thank you. happy to be here.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: before we start, id like to explain the structure of this interview. well discuss your background, frontend experience with react, backend exposure, and project experience. lets begin with your introduction. can you tell me about yourself and your technical background?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: sure. i recently completed my training in full stack development. i have worked mainly with javascript, react, and some basic backend technologies. im still building my experience through practice projects.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats fine. lets talk about frontend development first. can you explain what react is and why it is used?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: react is a javascript library used to build user interfaces. it helps in creating reusable components and makes the ui faster.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good. can you explain the concept of components in react?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: components are reusable pieces of ui. we can create functional or class components.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: how do you manage state in react?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have used usestate hook for managing state in components.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked with more advanced state management solutions like redux or context api?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: ive heard about redux, but i havent used it in my projects yet.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: alright. lets move on to project experience. have you worked on any real-time or production-level projects?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: not really. i have mainly worked on demo applications and small practice projects during my course.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you describe one of those projects and your role in it?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i created a simple react application with a form and some basic validation. it was mostly for learning purposes.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: did you handle any backend integration or api calls in that project?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i made some basic api calls, but the backend was already available. i didnt design the backend myself.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: okay. from a full stack perspective, how comfortable are you with backend concepts like databases or apis?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have basic knowledge, but i still need more hands-on experience.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you for your honesty. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions at the moment. thank you for the interview.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, rahul. it was nice speaking with you. well get back to you regarding the next steps.

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: thank you. have a great day.
